sections.heading: What is the Potential Form?
sections.content:
The potential form expresses ability or possibility - what you "can do" or what's "possible to do."

読む → 読める "read" → "can read" 食べる → 食べられる "eat" → "can eat" する → できる "do" → "can do"

children.heading: Group 1 (五段 Godan Verbs)
children.content:
Change final -u to -eru:

| Dictionary Form | Potential Form | Meaning | | --------------- | ----------------- | --------- | | 書く (kaku) | 書ける (kakeru) | can write | | 読む (yomu) | 読める (yomeru) | can read | | 話す (hanasu) | 話せる (hanaseru) | can speak | | 買う (kau) | 買える (kaeru) | can buy | | 泳ぐ (oyogu) | 泳げる (oyogeru) | can swim | | 飲む (nomu) | 飲める (nomeru) | can drink | | 会う (au) | 会える (aeru) | can meet |

children.heading: Group 2 (一段 Ichidan Verbs)
children.content:
Replace -ru with -rareru:

| Dictionary Form | Potential Form | Meaning | | --------------- | ----------------------- | ----------- | | 食べる (taberu) | 食べられる (taberareru) | can eat | | 見る (miru) | 見られる (mirareru) | can see | | 起きる (okiru) | 起きられる (okirareru) | can wake up | | 寝る (neru) | 寝られる (nerareru) | can sleep | | 着る (kiru) | 着られる (kirareru) | can wear |

children.heading: Group 3 (Irregular Verbs)
children.content: | Dictionary Form | Potential Form | Meaning | | --------------- | ------------------- | -------- | | する (suru) | できる (dekiru) | can do | | 来る (kuru) | 来られる (korareru) | can come |

sections.heading: Shortened Potential Form (ら-抜き)
sections.content:
Casual speech often drops ら:

| Standard | Shortened | Meaning | | ---------- | --------- | ----------- | | 食べられる | 食べれる | can eat | | 見られる | 見れる | can see | | 起きられる | 起きれる | can wake up |

Standard: 食べられる Casual: 食べれる Both mean "can eat"

Note: The shortened form is common in conversation but technically incorrect. Use the full form in formal writing.

children.heading: Pattern: Subject + は/が + Potential Verb
children.content: 私は日本語が話せます "I can speak Japanese" 彼は泳げる "He can swim" ここで写真が撮れますか？ "Can I take photos here?"

sections.heading: Particle: を → が
sections.content:
Important: With potential form, the direct object marker を changes to が:

Plain verb: 本を読む "I read books" Potential: 本が読める "I can read books"

Plain: 寿司を食べる Potential: 寿司が食べられる "I can eat sushi"

Why? The potential form is intransitive - you don't "do" to something, you have the "ability" regarding something.

children.heading: Can you...?
children.content: 日本語が話せますか？ "Can you speak Japanese?" 泳げますか？ "Can you swim?" 車が運転できますか？ "Can you drive a car?"

children.heading: I can...
children.content: 漢字が読めます "I can read kanji" ピアノが弾けます "I can play piano" 自転車に乗れます "I can ride a bike"

children.heading: I can't...
children.content: 日本語が話せません "I can't speak Japanese" 泳げない "I can't swim" 早く起きられない "I can't wake up early"

sections.heading: Expressing Possibility
sections.content:
The potential form also expresses possibility (something is possible):

ここから富士山が見える "Mt. Fuji can be seen from here" この店でクレジットカードが使えます "Credit cards can be used at this store" 明日会えますか？ "Can we meet tomorrow?" (Is it possible?)

sections.heading: Past Tense
sections.content: 昨日は泳げた "I could swim yesterday" 子供の時、ピアノが弾けました "I could play piano when I was a child" 見られなかった "I couldn't see"

sections.heading: Negative Form
sections.content: 泳げない - can't swim 食べられない - can't eat できない - can't do 来られない - can't come

children.heading: Polite Negative
children.content: 泳げません 食べられません できません 来られません

children.heading: Example 1: Language Ability
children.content: A: 英語が話せますか？ "Can you speak English?" B: はい、少し話せます "Yes, I can speak a little" A: 中国語は？ "How about Chinese?" B: いいえ、話せません "No, I can't speak it"

children.heading: Example 2: Skills
children.content: A: 料理ができますか？ "Can you cook?" B: はい、少しできます "Yes, I can cook a little" A: 何が作れますか？ "What can you make?" B: カレーとパスタが作れます "I can make curry and pasta"

children.heading: Example 3: Making Plans
children.content: A: 明日会えますか？ "Can you meet tomorrow?" B: すみません、明日は会えません "Sorry, I can't meet tomorrow" A: じゃあ、週末は？ "Then, how about the weekend?" B: 週末なら会えます "I can meet on the weekend"

children.heading: 見える vs 見られる
children.content:
Both can mean "can see":

見える (mieru) - Naturally visible:

窓から海が見える "The ocean can be seen from the window" (It's naturally visible)

見られる (mirareru) - Able to see/watch:

この映画が見られますか？ "Can you watch this movie?" (Have the ability/permission)

children.heading: 聞こえる vs 聞ける
children.content:
聞こえる (kikoeru) - Naturally audible:

音楽が聞こえる "I can hear music" (Sound reaches my ears)

聞ける (kikeru) - Able to listen/ask:

質問が聞けますか？ "Can I ask a question?" (Have the ability/permission)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using を instead of が
children.content: Wrong: 日本語を話せます ❌ Right: 日本語が話せます ✓ "I can speak Japanese"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong conjugation
children.content: Wrong: 食べるられる ❌ Right: 食べられる ✓ "Can eat" Wrong: 書かれる (this is passive!) ❌ Right: 書ける ✓ "Can write"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing potential with passive
children.content: Potential: 食べられる (can eat) Passive: 食べられる (is eaten) Context makes it clear!

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using potential for requests
children.content: Less natural: 窓を開けられますか？ ⚠️ Better: 窓を開けてもらえますか？ ✓ "Could you open the window?" Potential = ability, not request!

children.heading: For specific verbs: Use potential form
children.content: 泳げます "I can swim" 読めます "I can read"

children.heading: For する verbs: Use できる
children.content: 料理ができます "I can cook" (料理する → できる) 運転ができます "I can drive" (運転する → できる)

children.heading: For general ability: Both work
children.content: 日本語ができます ✓ 日本語が話せます ✓ "I can (do) Japanese" / "I can speak Japanese"

children.heading: Physical ability
children.content: 100メートル泳げる "I can swim 100 meters" 重い物が持てる "I can lift heavy things"

children.heading: Learned skill
children.content: ピアノが弾ける "I can play piano" 車が運転できる "I can drive"

children.heading: Permission/Possibility
children.content: ここで写真が撮れますか？ "Can I take photos here?" 今日は早く帰れる "I can go home early today"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 泳げる 食べれる (shortened) できる

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 泳げます 食べられます できます

children.heading: Very Polite (Questions)
children.content: 泳げますでしょうか？ 食べられますでしょうか？

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 日本語が話せます "I can speak Japanese" 漢字が読めます "I can read kanji" 泳げません "I can't swim"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 明日は早く起きられますか？ "Can you wake up early tomorrow?" ここから富士山が見えます "Mt. Fuji can be seen from here" 辛い物が食べられません "I can't eat spicy food"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 子供の頃は一日中遊べましたが、今は時間がありません "When I was a child I could play all day, but now I don't have time" この資料は明日までに読めますか？ "Can you read these materials by tomorrow?" 彼なら絶対にできると信じています "I believe he can definitely do it"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜ことができる - Alternative "can" expression Potential vs Ability - Nuance differences Passive form - Similar conjugation 〜やすい/〜にくい - Easy/hard to do Permission expressions - てもいい Possibility expressions - かもしれない

Possibility expressions - かもしれない
